Posts.Content: Hi Isingbass, no, not you at all - I can't stand the smell of perfumes/ aftershave / cigarette smoke etc - really makes me feel dreadfully nauseous . Strange thing is tho , this started about 6 weeks before I had the mammogram and referral and had no idea about the BC. Also, at the same time, our dog has always slept in the kitchen and has never ever attempted to come upstairs, but suddenly crept upstairs to lay on the floor at the side of my bed. Husband scuttled her downstairs and eventually, we had to close safety gate to kitchen door. All she did was jump it , to get back up !!! Might add that she now settled back downstairs. BCN said she had heard this many times and that ? can they smell cancer - quite fascinating really, dogs used to smell out drugs , so makes you wonder ?? Only thing, will scare me to death if she starts coming upstairs again !!
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: Yes, find it fascinating now and trying to find different related articles. Our dog , a German Shepherd is very well trained / behaved. Will sit and stay where ever we tell her to and not move, irrespective of time to telling her she can. Despite being 'told off' send downstairs and told to stay, she immediately crept very quietly back up to lay at the side of my bed. Her behaviour was just so weird and totally out of character . Re smells, I'd always loved my hubbys Prada aftershave and initially thought it may have gone off - went on hol prior to mammogram and spent £60 on a different one, only to react the same - he has to put it on at the front door just before he goes to golf and not to put any on if I'm in the car !! All quite interesting hearing other people's experiences X
Posts.Title: Weird sense of smell ?

Posts.Content: Whoops - know how you feel - I too got a very severe telling off - shivering, temp 40.6 - on blood test at hospital , it showed Neutrafils at 0.02 - diagnosed Neutrapenic sepsis and  Influenza A - spent 5 days in hospital and really felt quite ill. The Oncologist was furious - " do you know you can die with sepsis" !!!!! On future chemo sessions , I tel straight away with any rise !!!  Do hope you start to feel better soon - it certainly batters your energy levels etc for a while - so plenty of rest !!!! Love and best wishes Mechele
Posts.Title: My rush to A&E...

Posts.Content: Hi Dierdre, It does sound very much like shingles and boy, the nerve pain is quite 'uncomfortable ' to say the least. I had just finished chemo and had it on leg, going to inside of thigh. As I saw Dr within 24 -48 hrs of the blisters appearing I was able to have the antiviral tabs, plus was prescribed Gabapentin for the nerve pain .. Not sure it will show in your bloods or not , but do tell them when you go . Hoping all goes well. Love Mechele X X
Posts.Title: Shingles?

Posts.Content: JJsailor, so so sorry to hear that and really feel for you. Our dog is also very much part of the family and always had a GSD , although also love 'Labs' , such loving faithful friends. We had to have our last one put to sleep , aged 8 yrs, was totally heartbreaking. Always remember someone saying ' can't believe you being so upset just over a dog !!!! , some people just don't understand do they. Glad you got over your treatment, my last chemo yesterday, has been very hard, with 5 admissions, 3 episodes of neutropenic sepsis etc, so praying I have just one without an admission!!! Start rads on 1/6/16 - 21/6/16, my last rad in my 66 th b/d when we should have been on hol, but least of my worries. As mine on left breast and all lymph nodes removed, do worry about any effect on heart and lung tissue.  Anyway, thinking of you and sending love and hugs to hopefully help get you through such a difficult time, and believe me, I really can appreciate what you are feeling. Mechele X
Posts.Title: What is it with cancer?

Posts.Content: Hi Bijou - oh my word Couldn't believe your first post on how much you'd shrunk !!!! Do hope all goes well for you - sending big hugs and best wishes , Mechele . Ps see you love animals/ dogs. We've always had German Shepherd's and it was weird how her behaviour changed just before I was diagnosed last Nov. The BCN said she had heard this many times - quite interesting really X X
Posts.Title: Physical changes .

Posts.Content: Hi Banananambs ( think I got that right )  Do get this checked out but could be nothing much to worry about - several years ago, my son ( about 16/17 at the time) had the same - fit young lad / footballer and kept fit , was quite conscious of at the time as he felt you could see it through a t. shirt ( couldn’t!)- saw GP and was just ‘ gynomastica ‘ ( probably got spelling wrong) - just went on their own after a few months - Dr said quite common and due to increase in hormones. Do hope all turns ok Best wishes Mechele x
Posts.Title: Lumps in chest?

Posts.Content: Hi collies, I had a WLE on 1/12/15 and due to positive nodes , I had full node clearance. I will say, I haven't had any problem whatsoever - BUT, I do  the exercises given prior to discharge ( just had overnight stay as I was last on the afternoon theatre list !). Some Drs say to just do these exercises foe about 4 weeks, whereas others say do them Indefinately - they're only gentle exercises and don't take more than 5 mins, and it definately maintains good arm / shoulder movement and I have had no hint of any possible Lymphodema . I also had 15 sessions of radiotherapy. I hope this reassures you and sure all will go well on the 5th With best wishes, Mechele X X
Posts.Title: LYMPH NODES BEING REMOVED SOON

Posts.Content: Hi jammy R - wow, was quite surprised reading all that !! I had wle 18 months ago - no problem whatsoever. No drain , in overnight ( but due to being last on afternoon list and quite drowsy with anaesthetic. I still do the arm exercises daily, initially twice daily , have full movement of arm/shoulder , some numbness down upper back of arm, but forget I've got that. I just remind staff / Drs etc re any injections/ blood tests that they are done in other arm. Sure you will be fine as nowhere near as alarming as being said. Sending best wishes, Mechele .
Posts.Title: Axillary Node Clearence

Posts.Content: Hi Sab , Interesting to read your post and totally understand your worries. I commenced Letrozole on my first day of radiotherapy last June - within a week , started with a cough , sometimes voice going quite hoarse after exercise. Ct scan , X-rays all show all ok , and I too feel it's more throat rather than lungs !!! . It's so worrying isn't it - initially I thought ' the radiotherapy to breast and chest wall have damaged my lungs' etc etc .and the cough is now diminishing to some degree . I have found a difference regarding s/e of Letrozole with regards to brands - most Drs will not prescribe Femara due to huge cost difference and found the Cipla brand was awfull. I'm now settled on Dr Reddy's brand with less evident side effects. I'm sure you have nothing to worry about - however you know your own body and if you do feel something is wrong , then persist with your BC nurse. Do hope it settles for you and able to feel less anxious . I'm sure we all initially feel quite paranoid after the stress of our BC journey. Sending big hugs , Mechele X X X
Posts.Title: Coughing with no other symptoms

Posts.Content: Ali owl - just love the name - my family sooooo giddy about Saturday - trains were booked straight after last match - tickets hopefully will arrive tomorrow - bought Wednesday - Husband, 2 sons , 1 daughter and 1 grandson ( other son gutted due to being in Florida, although has already found a bar to watch it  ( along with his friend Danny Cadamarteri , under 18 Wed coach who is with him on holiday along with wife and sons ) Do hope they win, don't know if I dare watch it . I've just finished chemo ( what a killer ) and had rads planning today - can't wait for this nightmare over with and to some normal life hopefully. What about you.
Posts.Title: Just saying hello ....

Posts.Content: Recently diagnosed with breast and lymph node cancer, had surgery, and awaiting appointment with oncologist. Understand will commence chemotherapy in January. Feeling scared
Posts.Title: Recently diagnosed breast and lymph node cancer. Chemo in January...

Posts.Content: Hi Iona - I commence chemo on 15/1/16 and my oncologist said that I would lose all hair by the end of January . I too am dreading how ideous I will look - have got appt for the 'wig lady' to see me this week, but what about at night - really don't want my husband to see me bald - he insists it really doesn't matter and loves me regardless - but it matters to me. I'm sorry you too are finding it difficult and just don't know what to say to help, but hope it gets easier for you. Best wishes Mechele
Posts.Title: I'm not 'me'

Posts.Content: Hi, I had 6 cycles of Docetaxel / Taxotere and Cyclophosphamide - 8 steroids day before, 8 on day of chemo and 8 the following day - hardly slept those 3 nights, in fact felt a bit hyper ! Cooked/baked things for freezing so had meals all ready for tired days. No sickness, or particularly bone pain. All hair departed on 8th day of first cycle . The biggest problem was with the neutrafils - ie neutropenic sepsis on day 7-9 . Didn't have contact with young grandchildren , avoided shopping precincts etc etc but every cycle had to be hospitalised for 4 days . It became a standing joke on each discharge - shall I book my bed now for such and such date !!! Had the injections on last 2 cycles to no avail. Time went so quick and it could have been worse. Everyone reacts differently and you may not have many side effects at all - the main thing is it is hopefully clearing any 'squatters' as I called them and all being evicted. I'm sure you will be fine . Sending hugs and best wishes X X X
Posts.Title: Truth about doxetaxel

Posts.Content: Hi , I had 6 cycles of Taxotere and Cyclophosphamide at 3 weekly intervals - I was told i would lose my hair, but didn't think it would be so quick - day 8 after the first cycle ! Was shopping in Debenhams with my daughter on the Saturday morning , scratched an itch on my head , only to find a full handful . My hairdresser very kindly did a grade 2 in the afternoon- we were both crying and pleased no one else in the salon. I was asked if I wanted to try the cold cap , however as it meant being in the unit for an extra 2-3 hours / being prone to headaches etc , decided not to bother. Still. a whole new meaning to 'wash and go' ha ha -- shower, dry head, wig on and GO !! No having to buy shampoo and conditioner, no leg waxing ( amongst other areas ha ha ) , pencil eyebrows, lashes seemed the last to go.  Hope all goes well - drink plenty , meaning WATER , check temp regularly ( before taking any paracetamol etc, as thes mask correct body temp ) . As my Neutrafils dropped significantly and therefore prone to picking up infections , I avoided areas like supermarkets, shopping precincts ( particularly touching escalators, public toilet door handles). I suppose s/e vary a little on which drugs you are having.  Wishing you love and best wishes for your treatment, it's surprising how quickly it goes by.  Mechele
Posts.Title: Loosing your hair...

Posts.Content: Hi puzzler - interesting reading your post - I too am on Letrozole ( one in a morning ) , was fine to begin with, then after about 3-4 weeks started with the horrible morning sickness / nausea - very debilitating . Onc said to take it at night with one cyclizine - yehh solved Hope this helps , Mechele
Posts.Title: SICKNESS / NAUSEA 5 MONTHS AFTER CHEMO & RADIOTHERAPY

Posts.Content: Hi Jj1, totally understand how you are feeling- sure we all do after undergoing such a life changing experience. I had surgery for IDC in November 15, followed by 6 cycles of Taxotere ( boy it was evil !!- was hospitalised on all 6    -4-5 nights ech time with sepsis / infections etc and thought I'd never get through it ), then radiotherapy. My first mammogram will be sometime in November and am sure will be a total utter wreck with the same thoughts as you !!!!. It never fails to surprise me how people respond after the end of active treatment -- ' oh you fine now and it's in the past ' - if only it was that simple !! . On a lighter note , my 2 year old grandaughter took hold of one of my fingers the other day, looking quite disgruntled saying ' Mamar , you should not bite your nails , so sit on bottom of stairs for time out !!!!. In actual fact, yes my nails do look horrendous ,as are dropping off half way down due to the Tax and previously always had nice nails. Time out hasn't made them grow any quicker ha ah . Wishing you all the best for a good result , and await your post saying this. Best wishes, Mechele X X x
Posts.Title: First year follow up mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi Suzeanna - I had lumpectomy ( due to being a 34dd and surgeon was sure she could get clear margins due to 'ample bosom ') but because of positive nodes I had full node clearance. Started the gentle exercises given day after surgery and increased after 14 days as per their instructions . Surgery done last December, 2015, so now 12 months post surgery at age 65, now 66. I will say I had no problem whatsoever , full movement virtually within 2-3 weeks , still do the exercises but just once daily, initially 3 times a day. Yes, there could be a risk of lymphodema in the future, but wanted to give myself the best possible chance. I wonder how many DONT have problems to the ones that DO . Wishing you all the best, Mechele X X
Posts.Title: Terrified at the thought of axillary clearance
